title: Jessica Alba is the epitome of autumn style in a brown sweater paired
text:
Jessica Alba was bundled up in a comfy-looking brown sweater with princess-style sleeves and ribbed knit material on Thursday as she walked the streets of LA alongside her family including her mom Catherine Alba and husband Cash Warren.

The actress-turned-businesswoman paired the sweater with some matching cropped pants in the same tone and on the bottom wore sandals that had leather straps, one of the straps in leopard print.

Alba, 38, shaded her vision with some tortoise-shell sunglasses of an oval shape.

Warm: Jessica Alba was bundled up in a comfy-looking brown sweater with princess-style sleeves and ribbed knit material on Thursday as she walked the streets of LA alongside her family including her mom Catherine Alba and husband Cash Warren

She and her mother appeared to have just emerged from MedMen cannabis dispensaries with a purchase.

The appearance comes as fashion designer and entrepreneur Rebecca Minkoff recently revealed she swaps 'war stories' with Alba.

'As great as you think her life is, I’ll see her and she’s like, "F**k, it’s hard."' I really admire her career that she’s built. It’s been from a really authentic place,' Minkoff told People at the 5th annual Beaches Resorts Social Media on the Sand conference in Turks & Caicos.

On-the-go: She and her mother appeared to have just emerged from MedMen cannabis dispensaries with a purchase

She added: 'I really admire her career that she’s built. It’s been from a really authentic place.'

Alba co-founded The Honest Company, a consumer goods company that sells baby, personal and household products in 2011.

The Pomona, Calif. native was inspired by the birth of her daughter Honor as well as her own childhood illnesses when coming up with the concept for the company.

All in the family: Her husband Cash Warren wore a navy blue jacket and matching pants; Cash pictured with their children Hayes, 21 months, and daughters Honor, 11, and Haven, eight

She was especially motivated to get serious about her company after her mother's laundry detergent recommendation left her broken out with welts.

Although she was encouraged to start small, Alba launched the company in 2013 with 17 products.

In the U.S. the FDA has only banned a dozen harmful chemicals, while Europe has banned over 1,300.

The Honest Company works to avoid placing those 1,300 chemicals into products.
